snippet: Delawar Hossain Sayedee, a top leader of a fundamentalist Islamic political party, was convicted of committing crimes against humanity.
abstract: Violent clashes between protesters and security forces erupt across Bangladesh after special war crimes tribunal hands down death sentence to Delawar Hossain Sayedee, leader of Islamist party Jamaat-e-Islami, for crimes against humanity committed during country's 1971 war of independence from Pakistan; verdict resonates with young protesters who have condemned Jamaat but infuriates its followers.

byline.original: By JULFIKAR ALI MANIK and JIM YARDLEY
byline.contributor: Julfikar Ali Manik reported from Dhaka, and Jim Yardley from New Delhi.

lead_paragraph: Delawar Hossain Sayedee, a top leader of a fundamentalist Islamic political party, was convicted of committing crimes against humanity.

headline.seo: Riots in Bangladesh Over Islamist’s Death Sentence
headline.main: Islamist’s Death Sentence Sets Off Riots in Bangladesh
headline.print_headline: Islamist’s Death Sentence Sets Off Riots in Bangladesh

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
